marketNews.title: OPEC+ Meeting Postponed to December 5, Discussing Supply Restoration
marketNews.content: OPEC+ announced that it will postpone its meeting scheduled for December 1, 2024, to December 5, 2024, because several member state ministers will be attending the Gulf Cooperation Council meeting in Kuwait. According to a Bloomberg report, OPEC usually changes meeting dates when they need more time to finalize an agreement. The OPEC+ meeting will discuss whether they will continue the supply recovery, with the initial phase increasing oil production by 180,000 barrels per day in January 2025. According to the Bloomberg report, OPEC+ delegates have begun talks to delay this move, which is likely to last for several months.

marketNews.title: Minister Bahlil Signals Online Motorcycle Taxis Will Not Be Allowed to Consume Subsidized Fuel
marketNews.content: The Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, Bahlil Lahadalia, signaled that online motorcycle taxis (ojol) will not be permitted to consume subsidized fuel oil (BBM) such as Pertalite, given that ojol is a business activity. However, Bahlil stated that ojol drivers or drivers can still receive subsidies if they meet the criteria.

marketNews.title: Ministry of Trade Targets Harbolnas 2024 Transaction Growth of +13-16% YoY Amidst Declining Public Purchasing Power
marketNews.content: The Director General at the Ministry of Trade, Moda Simatupang, stated that they are targeting the 2024 National Online Shopping Day (Harbolnas) transaction to grow by +13-16% Year-on-Year compared to the 2023 realization, despite declining public purchasing power. This target is based on the rapid transaction growth of Harbolnas in previous years, with transaction realizations increasing from 9.1 trillion Rupiah in 2019 to 25.7 trillion Rupiah in 2023. Harbolnas 2024 will take place from December 10-16, 2024.

marketNews.title: Government Agrees to Reduce Domestic Flight Ticket Prices by 10% During Christmas and New Year Period
marketNews.content: The Spokesperson for the Ministry of Transportation, Elba Damhuri, stated that the government has agreed to reduce domestic flight ticket prices by 10% for domestic flights at all airports in Indonesia. This price reduction applies during the Christmas and New Year (Nataru) period from December 19, 2024, to January 3, 2025.

marketNews.title: Minister of ESDM Optimistic on Achieving 2025 Oil and Gas Lifting Target of 605,000 Bph
marketNews.content: The Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, Bahlil Lahadalia, stated that his ministry is optimistic about achieving or exceeding the 2025 oil and gas lifting target of 605,000 barrels per day. Bahlil explained that this target can be realized through 3 methods: technological intervention in oil wells, encouraging oil and gas development in wells that have finished exploration, and conducting oil and gas exploration. Although optimistic about the 2025 target, Bahlil emphasized that he cannot promise that the 2024 lifting target of 635,000 barrels per day will be achieved.

marketNews.title: BPN: President Prabowo Will Review the Status of PIK 2 as a National Strategic Project (PSN)
marketNews.content: The Minister of Agrarian Affairs and Spatial Planning/Head of the National Land Agency, Nusron Wahid, stated that President Prabowo Subianto will review the determination of the National Strategic Project (PSN) status for PIK 2, which is being developed by Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua. Nusron mentioned that his ministry will only ensure whether the project complies with the regional spatial plan (RTRW) or not, while the decision regarding the PSN status will be determined by the Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs and the President. Nusron affirmed that the PSN designation only covers approximately 1,700 hectares specifically for coastal tourism and not the residential areas.

marketNews.title: Government Negotiating with US and Russia for Nuclear Power Plant Technology, Considering Operation by 2036
marketNews.content: The Deputy at the National Development Planning Ministry/Bappenas, Vivi Yulaswati, stated that the government is currently negotiating with the US and Russia for technology related to the development of nuclear power plants (PLTN). Vivi also mentioned that the government is considering operating a nuclear power plant as early as 2036 to reduce dependence on fossil fuels. Vivi added that the government is currently open to the construction of small modular reactors and conventional nuclear technology.

tickerNews.title: ADRO Announces Dividend Value & Prospectus Summary for AADI Share Purchase Rights (PUPS)
tickerNews.content: Alamtri Resources Indonesia (ADRO) on Friday (29/11) announced the dividend value per share and the prospectus regarding the public offering by shareholders (PUPS) of Adaro Andalan Indonesia (AADI). Here is the summary: ADRO Dividend of 1,358 Rupiah per Share. This amount indicates a yield of 37% based on the ADRO share price of 3,670 Rupiah per share on the cum date on November 26, 2024. This dividend value is not far different from our estimate at 1,359 Rupiah per share. According to our calculation, this dividend amount can cover the costs required to exercise the AADI PUPS, excluding the transaction fee of 0.18% charged by Trimegah Sekuritas as the underwriter. AADI PUPS Subscription Ratio 4.389:1. ADRO announced that every holder of 4,389 ADRO shares is entitled to subscribe to 1,000 AADI shares. This figure is not far different from our calculation which estimated that every owner of 100 ADRO shares is entitled to subscribe to ~23 AADI shares (ratio 4.4:1). If it falls on a decimal calculation, the right to purchase shares will be rounded down. For illustration, if an investor holds 4,000 ADRO shares (~40 lots), the proportional calculation for the right to subscribe to AADI shares is (4,000) / (4.389) x (1,000) = 911.3693324 shares. Since the calculation result is in decimals, the right to subscribe to AADI shares will be rounded down to 911 shares. Offering Price for AADI Shares Ranges from 5,546-5,960 Rupiah per Share. The offering price for AADI shares through PUPS will be the volume-weighted average price (VWAP) per AADI share formed after the first trading day of AADI shares on the IDX on December 5, 2024. Nevertheless, the lower limit for subscription will use the fair value of AADI shares at 5,546 Rupiah per share, while the maximum limit will be 107.5% of the fair value of AADI shares, or 5,960 Rupiah per share. This calculation is also not far different from our calculation which estimated the AADI PUPS offering price to range from 5,550-5,950 Rupiah per share. Transaction Fee of 0.18% for Exercising AADI PUPS Shares. Investors who exercise their rights in the AADI PUPS will be charged a 0.18% fee by Trimegah Sekuritas as the underwriter for this corporate action. Note for Stockbit Users. The estimated period to exercise the right to subscribe to AADI shares via PUPS is December 7-10, 2024, with the estimated distribution of AADI shares on December 10-11, 2024. The cut-off time for subscribing to AADI PUPS is 10:00 AM Western Indonesia Time (WIB) every trading day during the subscription period. Subscribing to AADI PUPS after the cut-off time (after 10:00 AM WIB) will be processed on the following business day during the subscription period. Key Takeaway: During today's trading, Friday (29/11), the ADRO share price was locked at the lower auto reject (ARB) level of 2,070 Rupiah per share, before closing weaker by -24.6% at 2,080 Rupiah per share. This indicates that the decline in ADRO share price since the cum date on November 26, 2024, has exceeded the amount of dividend to be received. Therefore, as we wrote in the previous Stockbit Commentary, investors will be more advantaged if they use the ADRO dividend to participate in the AADI PUPS, considering investors can gain upside from the potential increase in AADI share price. Investors who do not participate in the AADI PUPS will miss out on ADRO's thermal coal business at a valuation of 2.7x P/E 1H24 annualized, lower than ADRO's historical 5-year mean and its peers. Furthermore, the decline in ADRO's share price - at least until today - is not as deep as we predicted in our base case scenario, so investors have the potential to gain greater profits than in that scenario if AADI shares rise in line with our expectations. For Stockbit users who wish to participate in the AADI PUPS, the estimated exercise period via the Stockbit application is December 7-10, 2024, with AADI share distribution on December 10-11, 2024. We suggest exercising no later than December 9, 2024, at 10:00 AM WIB.

tickerNews.title: BMRI 10M24: Bank Only Net Profit Grows +6.3% YoY
tickerNews.content: BMRI: Bank Mandiri recorded a decrease in net profit (bank only) to 4.1 trillion Rupiah (-11% YoY, -26% MoM) in October 2024, bringing the bank only net profit for 10M24 to 43.1 trillion Rupiah (+6.3% YoY). Loan growth in 10M24 reached +23% YoY (vs. 9M24: +22% YoY), which is above management's consolidated FY24 guidance in the range of +16-18% YoY. The Net Interest Margin (NIM) remained relatively stable at 4.6% in October 2024 despite tightening liquidity (LDR ~95%), so the NIM for 10M24 stood at 4.6% (vs. 10M23: 5%). Meanwhile, provisioning expenses increased again in October, causing credit cost (CoC) to reach 0.9% (vs. October 2023: 0.6%, September 2024: -0.16%. tickerNews.title: PANI Tycoon Aguan Negotiates with China and Singapore Partners for PIK 2 Port Development, Potentially Needing Over IDR 5 Trillion CAPEX in 2025
tickerNews.content: Sugianto Kusuma, or Aguan, President Director of Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua (PANI), stated to Bloomberg that they are currently negotiating with partners from China and Singapore to build a port in PIK 2, although he declined to provide further details. Aguan mentioned that PANI will likely require capital expenditure (capex) of more than 5 trillion Rupiah in 2025 to meet expansion plans. Bloomberg reported that PANI's expansion plans include building the largest convention center in Indonesia, a 5-star global hotel, and a circuit to host international races like Formula 1.

tickerNews.title: FILM Plans Rights Issue, Dilution Up to 9.09%, to Fund General Liquidity and Business Expansion
tickerNews.content: MD Entertainment (FILM) plans to conduct a rights issue of up to approximately 989.8 million (10%) shares with a dilution effect of up to 9.09%. The exercise price and ratio have not yet been announced, while the funds raised are intended for general liquidity needs, capital expenditure, working capital, and business development. This plan will be discussed at the GMSLB on December 2, 2024.

tickerNews.title: TOWR Subsidiaries Sign Joint Financing Facility Agreement of IDR 1 Trillion from Bank Syariah Indonesia (BRIS)
tickerNews.content: Sarana Menara Nusantara, through its subsidiaries, namely PT Profesional Telekomunikasi Indonesia, PT iForte Solusi Infotek, Solusi Tunas Pratama (SUPR), and Inti Bangun Sejahtera (IBST), signed a joint financing facility agreement worth 1 trillion Rupiah from Bank Syariah Indonesia (BRIS). The facility will mature 60 months from the realization of the financing, with the borrowers jointly ensuring the fulfillment of obligations.

tickerNews.title: ABMM Acquired 1 Coal Mine in 2024 and Finalizing Purchase of 2 More Mines, Targeting 1Q25 Transaction Completion
tickerNews.content: ABM Investama Director, Hans Cristian Manoe, stated that his company has acquired 1 coal mine during 2024 and is in the finalization process of purchasing 2 more coal mines. Hans did not provide further details regarding the mines acquired by ABMM, but he explained that the 2 mines to be acquired will be announced in December 2024 with a target transaction completion in Q1 2025. ABMM itself has realized 70% of its 2024 capex allocation, which ranges from 150-200 million US dollars, during 9M24, focusing on improving the services of its subsidiaries in the mining contractor sector.

tickerNews.title: CMRY Commissioner Wenzel Sutantio Sold 8.2 Million Shares, Transaction Value Reaches ~IDR 45 Billion
tickerNews.content: Cisarua Mountain Dairy Commissioner, Wenzel Sutantio, sold approximately 8.2 million CMRY shares at an average price of 5,500 Rupiah per share on November 22, 2024. The total transaction value reached approximately 45 billion Rupiah. Following this transaction, Wenzel's ownership in CMRY decreased from 7.18% to 7.08%.

tickerNews.title: WIKA Plans to Divest Minority Stake in Toll Road Assets (Balikpapan-Samarinda and Soreang-Pasirkoja) and Jatiluhur SPAM by End of 2024 or 1Q25
tickerNews.content: Wijaya Karya Corporate Secretary, Mahendra Vijaya, stated that the company plans to continue selling several toll road assets with minority ownership, including the Balikpapan-Samarinda toll section and the Soreang-Pasirkoja toll road. Additionally, Mahendra mentioned that WIKA plans to sell the Jatiluhur drinking water supply system (SPAM) in East Bekasi, where the company owns an 88.38% stake in the asset. However, Mahendra did not specify the target sales value for these assets, but said that the divestment is likely to be realized by the end of 2024 or Q1 2025. Mahendra added that in the next few years, WIKA will only focus on its core business and will not undertake business expansion in order to improve the company's liquidity and cash flow.
